text: The Baïse or Grande Baïse () is a French river that flows through the Hautes- Pyrénées, Gers and Lot-et-Garonne departments, in the Occitanie and Nouvelle- Aquitaine regions. The river's source is in the Pyrenees and is a left tributary of the Garonne river. In general, it flows from south to north. ==Geography== The Baïse river has a length of and a drainage basin with an area of . Its average yearly discharge is at Nérac, a small town of the Lot- et-Garonne department that is at about of the confluence with the Garonne river. The largest discharges are during winter and spring, with in February. The Baïse flows through 2 regions, 3 departments and 52 communes. Some of the communes are: * Occitanie region ** Hautes-Pyrénées : Lannemezan, Trie-sur-Baïse ** Gers : Mirande, Castéra-Verduzan, Valence-sur- Baïse, Condom * Nouvelle-Aquitaine region ** Lot-et-Garonne : Moncrabeau, Nérac, Lavardac, Buzet-sur-Baïse Finally, it flows into the Garonne river at Saint-Léger (Lot-et-Garonne), at of altitude. ==Main tributaries == * Left tributaries ** Gélise - * Right tributaries ** Baïsole - ** Petite Baïse - ** Auloue - ==Gallery== File:Valence hafen.jpg|Port on the Baïse in Valence- sur-Baïse File:FR-47-Nérac4.JPG|The Baïse at Nérac File:Nérac vieux pont 4.JPG|The old bridge on the Baïse at Nérac ==Related pages== * List of rivers of France == References == ==Other websites== * Banque Hydro - MEDDE, «Synthèse de la Banque Hydro - (O6692910)» * Histoire & Patrimoine des Rivières & Canaux - Rivière Baïse * River Baïse: Cruising in Detail Category:Rivers of Occitanie Category:Rivers of Nouvelle-Aquitaine
